title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 28.3 - Established wire services
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 28.3 - Established wire services

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part, a wire service is any
person, firm, copartnership, association or corporation which provides
assistance to registrants in securing permits, licenses, registrations and
similar governmental documentation necessary to operate commercial vehicles. In
order to qualify as an established wire service, a wire service must have
authority from the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance to issue
temporary truck mileage tax and fuel tax permits and authority from the New

York State Department of Transportation to issue overweight and dimension
permits. Established wire services may assist registrants in obtaining

Temporary Evidence of Apportioned Registration from this department and issue
trip permits to registrants in accordance with the provisions of this Part and
such services may charge fees for such assistance. An established wire service
shall not be deemed to be a private service bureau and need not be licensed
pursuant to section
395
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
28.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
